titlestmt.titleproper: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Population Program, Office Files of Lyle Saunders
A Guide to the Ford Foundation records, International Division, Population Program, Office Files of Lyle Saunders FA631
titlestmt.author: Arranged and described by Daniel Bruce May, Ford Foundation Archives, February 1985

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2015-08-11 04:02:42 -0400.

did.unittitle: Ford Foundation records, International Division, Population Program, Office Files of Lyle Saunders
did.abstract: The International Division/Population Papers of Lyle Saunders were transferred to the Ford Foundation Archives in 1982. The papers consist of correspondence, inter-office memoranda, and reports. They are divided into two series: Population Files and Correspondence Files. Arrangement within each series corresponds as closely as possible to the original order established by Saunders' office.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Lyle Saunders, Ford Foundation Program Officer in the International Division (ID), was a member of the Foundation staff from 1964 until 1975. During this period, he held the following positions:

• January 1975, Program Officer, Population Office and Asia and Pacific, ID • January 1974, Program Officer, Population Office, ID • January 1973, Advisor in Program Management seconded to the IBRD - National Family Planning Coordinating Board, Jakarta, ID • January 1971, Program Advisor, A&P, Southeast Asia (Thailand), ID • May 1968, Program Officer, Population Office, ID • July 1967, Program Advisor, Population Office (Malaysia), ID • January 1967, Program Officer, Population Office, ID • October 1966, Associate Director, Population Program, OD • February 1964, Program Associate, Population Program, OD

Lyle Saunders was born October 16, 1907. He received his B.A. and M.A. degrees in 1938 and 1943 respectively, from the University of New Mexico. He did additional course work at the Universities of Chicago and Texas.
Prior to Saunders' career with the Ford Foundation, he held the following positions:

• 1942-1951, University of New Mexico Assistant Professor of Sociology, School of Inter-American Affairs • 1951-1964, University of Colorado, Associate Professor of Sociology, Associate Professor of the Department of Preventive Medicine, Acting Head of the Department of Preventive Medicine and Public Health, School of Medicine, Director of the Institute of Behaviorial Science • 1961-1962, Government of India Advisor in Research and Evaluation, Central Health Education Bureau

Following his reitrement from the Ford Foundation, Mr. Saunders served the Foundation as a consultant on population related matters off and on from March 1976 until September 1980. He now resides in Santa Fe, New Mexico.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: These papers, which consist of two boxes of correspondence, inter-office memoranda, and reports, are concerned with the International Division's Population Program for the years 1963 to 1970.

The papers, which are broad in scope, yet lacking in quantity and depth, include material related to population conferences attended by FF staff, overseas program population files, budget material, and other areas of Foundation family planning involvement, including contraceptive research. The papers are indicative of the role Saunders played within the Population Program.
There is also one box of correspondence that Saunders maintained with FF colleagues, grantee organizations, and other individuals in the population field.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The International Division/Population Papers of Lyle Saunders are divided into two series:

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Staff and consultant reports and publications have been pulled and accessioned into the FF Archives. A cross-reference sheet located within the folders denotes accessioned material. A list of titles removed from the papers is appended to this register. Papers not related to Ford Foundation activities have been removed.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Material more than ten years old is open for scholarly research
Select individual files are restricted, as noted. Permission to access these files must be obtained from the Ford Foundation before scholarly access is permitted.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Completion of a use agreement is required prior to providing scholarly access. See RAC Head of Reference (or applicable designee) for details.
Ford Foundation holds title, copyright and literary rights in the collection, in so far as it holds them.

The Rockefeller Archive Center has authority to grant permission to cite and publish material from the collection for scholarly purposes. Permission to publish extensive excerpts, or material in its entirety, will be referred to the Ford Foundation.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Ford Foundation archive was deposited at RAC in 2011. Ford Foundation records, correspondence, reports, program files and officers papers were transferred to, and accessioned by, RAC beginning in 2011. Accessions continue as necessary.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Materials requiring specialized equipment for access (film, audio, video, slides) may be restricted from scholarly research dependent on availability of the applicable equipment.
Brittle or damaged items, or materials otherwise in need of preservation care, may be restricted from scholarly research at the discretion of the RAC Head of Archival Services/RAC Head of Reference.

did.unittitle: Population Files

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series I, Population Files (1963-1970), is the most substanitve. It contains material on the activities of the International Division's Population Program.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The files, which maintain the order established by Saunders' office, fall into five categories: Conference Files, which are arranged in reverse chronological order; Overseas Program Interest Files, which are arranged in alphabetical order; Family Planning and Population Program Budget Files, which are both arranged in reverse chronological order; and Grant Proposal Files, which are arranged in alphabetical order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Series II, Correspondence Files (1964-1970), contains correspondence generated by Mr. Saunders during his years at the Foundation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The correspondence is arranged in alphabetical order.

Appendix A: Lyle Saunders Reports Removed

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The following list of unpublished Ford Foundation reports by Lyle Saunders were removed from the papers. They are listed in alphabetical order. The number at the left, is the assigned accession number. They have been transferred to the Foundation's Archives collection of staff and consultant reports.

Appendix B: Other FF Reports Removed

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: The following list of unpublished reports written by other FF staff and consultants were removed from the papers. They are listed alphabetically by author. For each author, the reports are arranged in alphabetical order. The number at the left, is the assigned accession number. They have been transferred to the Foundation's Archives collection of staff and consultant reports.
